intro: Stylurus, commonly known as the genus of flowering plants in the family Rhamnaceae, consists of shrubs and small trees. These plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, often inconspicuous flowers. The fruits are typically capsules that split open to release seeds. Stylurus species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
